chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
q: X -> bool
p: X -> bool
A: list X

Goal:
filter p (filter q A) = filter q (filter p A)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
filter_and : forall p q A, filter p (filter q A) = filter (fun x => p x && q x) A
filter_pq_eq : forall p q A, (forall x, x el A -> p x = q x) -> filter p A = filter q A
filter_pq_mono : forall p q A, (forall x, x el A -> p x -> q x) -> filter p A <<= filter q A
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, a el ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type] ?B : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type] ?f : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- list ?A]
VectorSpec.to_list_of_list_opp : forall l : list ?A, VectorDef.to_list (VectorDef.of_list l) = l where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type]
filter_fst' : forall p x A, ~ p x -> filter p (x :: A) = filter p A
VectorDef.of_list : forall l : list ?A, VectorDef.t ?A (| l |) where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type]
filter_fst : forall p x A, p x -> filter p (x :: A) = x :: filter p A
filter_app : forall p A B, filter p (A ++ B) = filter p A ++ filter p B
filter_mono : forall p A B, A <<= B -> filter p A <<= filter p B
filter_id : forall p A, (forall x, x el A -> p x) -> filter p A = A
Pos.add_succ_l : forall p q : positive, (Pos.succ p + q)%positive = Pos.succ (p + q)
concat_filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list (list A)), concat (map (filter f) l) = filter f (concat l)
Pos.add_comm : forall p q : positive, (p + q)%positive = (q + p)%positive
filter_incl : forall p A, filter p A <<= A
in_filter_iff : forall x p A, x el filter p A < -> x el A /\ p x
NoDup_filter : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), NoDup l -> NoDup (filter f l)
List.filter_app : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l' : list A), filter f (l ++ l') = filter f l ++ filter f l'
positive_ind : forall P : positive -> Prop, (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~1)%positive) -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~0)%positive) -> P 1%positive -> forall p : positive, P p
filter_ext : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, filter f l = filter g l
Pos.peano_ind : forall P : positive -> Prop, P 1%positive -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (Pos.succ p)) -> forall p : positive, P p
filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l
ext_in_filter : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l -> forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
filter_ext_in_iff : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> (forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a)
Pos.add_1_l : forall p : positive, (1 + p)%positive = Pos.succ p
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
list_eq_dec : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec list X
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), x el filter f l < -> x el l /\ f x = true
minus_plus_simpl_l_reverse : forall n m p : nat, n - m = p + n - (p + m)

```coq
unfold filter. unfold filter in *.
induction A as [|a l IHl].
- reflexivity.
- rewrite IHl. destruct (q a). reflexivity. discriminate.
unfold filter. unfold filter in *.
induction A as [|a l IHl].
- reflexivity.
- rewrite IHl. destruct (p a). reflexivity. discriminate.
unfold filter. unfold filter in *.
induction A as [|a l IHl].
- reflexivity.
- rewrite IHl. destruct (q a). rewrite IHl. reflexivity. discriminate.
